Key Match Events: Coby White scored 23 points and had the first basket of Chicago’s 8-0 burst to begin overtime
White also had 10 rebounds and nine assists
Torrey Craig had 18 points for the Bulls
Nikola Vucevic posted 16 points and 13 rebounds
Josh Giddey had 13 points and 12 rebounds
Miles Bridges hit a game-tying 3 with 1.5 seconds left in the fourth quarter
Mark Williams provided 20 points and 12 rebounds
The Bulls scored 17 points in overtime, topping their 15-point first-quarter output
White’s offense came despite going 1-for-11 on threes. Patrick Williams and Craig made up for it by bagging five 3-pointers apiece
The Bulls had a cold spell down the stretch of regulation after leading 91-84 with just over four minutes to play
Mark Williams completed a three-point play with 1:32 left in regulation to bring Charlotte within 96-95
White’s short jumper stretched the Chicago lead to three with 1:09 remaining
Charlotte’s next two possessions resulted in a turnover and a missed 3-pointer, but the Bulls couldn’t put the game out of reach
After White’s jumper was off the mark, the Hornets got the ball back with 10.1 seconds to play before Bridges tied the contest
